definition: horse's head/same as 碼頭|码头[ma3 tou2], pier
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The soldier turned his horse quickly and plunged into the river.
sentences.chinese: 士兵迅速掉转马头，跳进河里。

sentences.english: The Queen's horse won by a head.
sentences.chinese: 女王的马以一马头之距领先获胜。

sentences.english: Queen's horse win by a head advantage.
sentences.chinese: 女王的马以一马头之距离获胜。

sentences.english: In Matou Town Xilian and his troops fought them tooth and nail at the cost of hundreds of casualties.
sentences.chinese: 锡联在马头镇拚了一次，一拚就是几百人伤亡。

sentences.english: He wheeled his horse about and galloped across the field.
sentences.chinese: 他拨转马头，策马驰过田野。

sentences.english: It had the shape of a horse's head.
Now, go out about the town covered in the horsehair sheet holding the horse’s head up on a pike.
sentences.chinese: 现在用长矛举着披着马毛床单的马头去游街吧。

sentences.english: Ma Fu'an shipbuilding limited liability company.
sentences.chinese: 福安市马头造船有限责任公司。

sentences.english: They wheeled their horses around and left.
Savoring the silence, we turned our horses around and they fell into a gallop.
sentences.chinese: 此时一片寂静，我们掉转马头，马儿开始飞奔起来。

sentences.english: The paper introduced the parameter optimization and construction method of smooth blasting of horse-head ingate.
sentences.chinese: 文中详述了马头门光面爆破参数的优化及施工方法。

sentences.english: He changed his horse when he saw the ugly girl.
sentences.chinese: 他看见那个丑姑娘就掉转马头。

sentences.english: He turned his horse's head and galloped away.
sentences.chinese: 他拨转马头飞也似地跑开了。

sentences.english: Overcoming her shudders, she bent over very gently to caress the horse's head.
sentences.chinese: 她克制住颤抖，非常轻柔地弯下腰去抚摸马头。

sentences.english: In his dining room, a self-made horse head string instrument caught my attention.
sentences.chinese: 饭厅里，一把自制的马头琴引起了我的注意。

sentences.english: The driver cracked the whip above the horse's head.
sentences.chinese: 车夫把鞭子在马头上方挥舞得噼啪作响。

definition: to turn/to turn around/to transfer (funds etc)
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
to guide a horse with the reins/to rein in a horse
to whip on/to raise a whip/by ext. to swagger
to reassign sb to a different job/to turn around/to change direction/to make a U turn
to dismount from a horse/(fig.) to abandon (a project)
to get on a horse/to mount
